definition: Qingming or Pure Brightness Festival or Tomb Sweeping Day, celebration for the dead (in early April)
Qing or Ch'ing dynasty of imperial China (1644-1911)/surname Qing
clear/distinct/quiet/just and honest/pure/to settle or clear up/to clean up or purge
Ming Dynasty (1368-1644)/surname Ming/Ming (c. 2000 BC), fourth of the legendary Flame Emperors, 炎帝[Yan2 di4] descended from Shennong 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2] Farmer God
bright/opposite: dark 暗[an4]/(of meaning) clear/to understand/next/public or open/wise/generic term for a sacrifice to the gods
see 節骨眼|节骨眼[jie1 gu5 yan3]
festival/holiday/node/joint/section/segment/part/to economize/to save/to abridge/moral integrity/classifier for segments, e.g. lessons, train wagons, biblical verses/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: I could not do something in Tomb Sweeping Day for many years.
sentences.chinese: 很多年我都没有办法在清明节这天祭奠祖人。

sentences.english: Qingming Festival is a folk Festival.
Xiang City, beginning from the Ching Ming Festival, about half the months to come.
sentences.chinese: 香市从清明节开始，约半个来月。

sentences.english: What do you usually do during the Qingming Festival?
sentences.chinese: 你们会在清明节做些什么？

sentences.english: Tomb-Sweeping Day comes when people go to the tombs of the deceased to pay their respect.
sentences.chinese: 清明节到了，正是给已故的人扫墓上坟的日子。

sentences.english: A friend and I went in this year's tomb-sweeping day six dynasties-nanjing.
sentences.chinese: 我和朋友在今年的清明节去了六朝古都南京。

sentences.english: Our hometown's traditional custom is to burn fake money to ancesters and forefathers in Tomb Sweeping Day.
sentences.chinese: 我们家乡的习俗，每到清明节都会去给祖人烧纸。

sentences.english: On the Pure Brightness, we burned some grave clothes for our dead Grandpa.
sentences.chinese: 清明节那天，我们给去世的爷爷烧了些冥衣。

sentences.english: This is our country ancient qingming festival customs.
sentences.chinese: 这是我国古代清明节习俗。

sentences.english: Different places have different foods for Qingming Festival.
sentences.chinese: 在清明节的饮食方面，各地有不同的节令食品。

sentences.english: On Tomb-sweeping Day, we paid our respects to revolutionary martyrs.
sentences.chinese: 清明节，我们拜扫了烈士墓。

sentences.english: Qingming is not just a day of remembrance. It sees a combination of sadness and happiness.
sentences.chinese: 清明节不仅仅是为了纪念，它是个悲喜交加的日子。

sentences.english: The Qingming Festival is a  statutory public holiday in mainland China.
sentences.chinese: 清明节在中国大陆地区是法定节假日。

sentences.english: On the Pure Brightness, we held a memorial service for martyrs in the funerary park.
sentences.chinese: 清明节那天我们在墓园里墓祭了烈士们的英灵。

sentences.english: Mom, I heard that there were many fire disasters by burning "paper money" on tomb-sweeping day last year.
sentences.chinese: 妈，我听说去年清明节烧纸钱发生了很多火灾。

sentences.english: Its origin dates back to the Spring and Autumn Period.
sentences.chinese: 清明节可以追溯到春秋时代。

definition: Dragon Boat Festival (5th day of the 5th lunar month)
the Mid-Autumn Festival on 15th of 8th lunar month
to sweep a grave (and pay one's respects to the dead person)
see 端午節|端午节[Duan1 wu3 jie2]
PRC National Day (October 1st)
International Labor Day (May Day)
Ghost Festival on 15th day of 7th lunar month when offerings are made to the deceased
to visit a grave
National Day
the Mid-autumn festival, the traditional moon-viewing festival on the 15th of the 8th lunar month
5-1 (May 1st)
Double Ninth or Yang Festival/9th day of 9th lunar month
Spring Festival (Chinese New Year)
Lantern Festival, the final event of the Spring Festival 春節|春节, on 15th of first month of the lunar calendar

Qixi Festival or Double Seven Festival on the 7th day of the 7th lunar month/girls' festival/Chinese Valentine's day, when Cowherd and Weaving maid 牛郎織女|牛郎织女[niu2 lang3 zhi1 nu:3] are allowed their annual meeting
lunar New Year's Eve
